metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15932 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - untriaged
metadata.Description:
In radare2 2.0.1, an integer exception (negative number leading to aninvalid memory access) exists in store_versioninfo_gnu_verdef() inlibr/bin/format/elf/elf.c via crafted ELF files when parsing the ELFversion on 32bit systems.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15932` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libradare2-2.3 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
libradare2-common - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
radare2 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: radare2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.0+dfsg-2').
